intro: Hormidium gilbertoi, commonly known as the Gilbert's hormidium, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Hormidium gilbertoi thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is an important component of its native ecosystem.
